title: Vance and Musk, Trump's two vice presidents
summary: Between JD Vance, the president's running mate, and Elon Musk, the ubiquitous billionaire, a de facto rivalry is taking hold, even in the corridors of the White House.

title: Rubio promises 'steadfast support' for Israel in Netanyahu call
summary: Trump's new Secretary of State pick Marco Rubio spoke with Benjamin Netanyahu on Wednesday and let him know that 'support for Israel is a top priority' for the 47th president, a State Department spokesperson said.

title: US Congress approves Trump crackdown on migrant criminal suspects
summary: Meanwhile, the Pentagon said Wednesday it has begun deploying 1,500 active duty troops to help secure the southern border in the coming days, putting in motion plans Trump laid out in executive orders shortly after he took office to crack down on immigration.

title: The first steps of a hopeful Syria through the eyes of photographer Abdulmonam Eassa, after more than five decades of dictatorship
summary: Originally from Ghouta, a suburb of Damascus bombed with chemical weapons in 2013, photographer Abdulmonam Eassa fled Syria seven years ago, leaving his family behind. When the fall of Bashar al-Assad was announced on December 8, 2024, he managed to return to his country and document the liberation of his people. He has provided 'Le Monde' with his testimony in pictures.

title: Evacuations ordered as new fast-moving wildfire threatens mountain homes north of Los Angeles
summary: Meanwhile, to the south, Los Angeles officials were preparing for potential rain even as some residents were allowed to return to the charred Pacific Palisades and Altadena areas. Gusty weather is expected to last through Thursday.

title: TikTok: 'In the US, the line of suitors is growing'
summary: The younger generation's favorite app has been granted a reprieve in the US by new president Donald Trump. But the hour of negotiations for the Chinese social media platform has now arrived, notes Philippe Escande, economic columnist at 'Le Monde.'

title: Mexican President Sheinbaum calls for 'cool heads' after first US decisions
summary: The country is preparing to welcome the migrants the Trump administration has promised to deport, and to cope with the extended stay of asylum seekers stranded in Mexico.

title: 'In the US, it's not just science that's under threat, but also the role it plays in democracy'
summary: As Donald Trump is inaugurated, former Health Minister Agnès Buzyn and political scientist Mélanie Heard call for political action to defend the fundamental role of science in public life, in an op-ed for 'Le Monde.'

title: LA fires cause major impact on water, air and natural habitats
summary: Urban fires, by spreading various pollutants, have even more harmful effects than forest fires. Residents of Pacific Palisades and Pasadena have been told not to drink tap water.

title: Young guns prove PSG can deliver in the Champions League without Mbappé
summary: Paris Saint-Germain beat Manchester City 4-2 on Wednesday. The team's re-designed attack finally clicked with four different scorers rather than relying too heavily on one to make the difference.

title: Greenland is 'a democracy, Greenlanders decide, nobody else'
summary: In Nuuk, the island's capital, US President Donald Trump's desire to take control of the autonomous territory belonging to Denmark has reinforced a growing desire for independence.

title: Trump wants to make Panama pay for favors granted to China
summary: The American president believes that control of the Panama Canal belongs to the United States, which completed the canal's construction and contests the presence of Chinese infrastructure there.

title: France issues new arrest warrant on Assad
summary: The Syrian dictator, overthrown on December 8, 2024, is accused of complicity in war crimes for a bombing raid that killed a French-Syrian teacher in Daraa in 2017.

title: Macron takes to the international stage
summary: Addressing military personnel on Monday, French President Emmanuel Macron stressed the 'threats' that are 'accumulating' against Europe as Donald Trump took office in Washington.

title: Knife attack in Germany kills two people, including a child
summary: The fatal stabbing in a Bavarian park left two others seriously injured. The suspect, an Afghan national, was arrested near the scene. German Chancellor Olaf Scholz demanded to know why the suspect had been able to stay in the country.

title: Nazi salute or not? US divided over Musk's gesture at Trump's inauguration ceremony
summary: The American press has remained cautious about interpreting the billionaire's gesture, and the debate is mostly taking place on X, the platform of a man holding an important role in the new Republican administration.

title: Photographer Mitch Epstein explores America's roots
summary: In a magnificent exhibition in Turin, the American artist continues his portrayal of his homeland through natural landscapes imbued with subtle political undertones.

title: Stargate, Trump's $500 billion project to boost artificial intelligence
summary: On Tuesday, Trump unveiled the Stargate project, set up by Oracle, OpenAI and SoftBank, to build giant data centers for the next generation of AI. The project will invest $100 billion immediately, rising to $500 billion by 2029.

title: Trump's second term and the risk of conflicts of interests
summary: As in his first term of office, the president is in danger of violating his legal and ethical obligations through his own empire, the Trump Organization, as well as the private equity fund of one of his sons-in-law.

title: The masked toad: A story full of twists and turns
summary: An international team has just traced the evolution of this iconic, toxic and invasive amphibian, with some surprising discoveries.

title: Faced with the risk of a trade war with the US, how will European countries respond?
summary: President Donald Trump is promising to raise trade barriers to Europe. How should they react? European countries are divided over this €1.5 trillion issue, and their means of retaliation are relatively limited.

title: Musk, Wikipedia founder in row over how to describe 'Nazi salute'
summary: The billionaire, who raised eyebrows Monday with a controversial-looking arm gesture at a Trump inauguration event, is fuming over a description of what some say looked like a Hitler salute, which was written on the encyclopedic site founded by entrepreneur Jimmy Wales.

title: Trump knocks FEMA, mulls letting disaster-hit US states fend for themselves
summary: The president's remarks came as an explosive new wildfire erupted north of Los Angeles, forcing tens of thousands of people to evacuate their homes and rattling nerves  in an area still reeling from two deadly blazes.

title: Donald Trump's historic turn in the White House: "common sense revolution" or conservative reaction?
summary: The new American president's pardon for the Capitol Hill rioters, including the most violent among them, and challenge to anti-discrimination policies illustrate a state, moral and societal upheaval.

title: 'The reformist left has breathed new life into itself, at the cost of obvious internal tensions'
summary: The Parti Socialiste, which has broken free of radical-left leader Jean-Luc Mélenchon, is not done with its battles. It will, by 2027, need to win back moderate voters who have shunned it for the past seven years, at a time when PM François Bayrou is seeking to forge a strong centrist bloc.

title: At the EU Parliament, Musk appeals to the far right
summary: In a debate on Tuesday, the nationalist right invoked 'freedom of expression' to defend American digital platforms against the application of European regulations.

title: French culture minister: 'On AI, the American model is not the European model'
summary: Ahead of the Artificial Intelligence Action Summit on February 10 and 11 in Paris, Rachida Dati is trying to alleviate concerns within the cultural sector about copyright. One proposed solution is the collective management of AI-related rights.

title: Sarkozy-Gaddafi trial: Hortefeux plays dumb but struggles to explain a 2005 visit to Libya
summary: In 2005, then-minister Brice Hortefeux visited Tripoli, where he met Abdullah al-Senoussi, the man behind the 1989 UTA DC-10 bombing, which killed 170 people. An unplanned meeting, he said, denouncing a 'trap.'

title: Nearly 2,000 LGBTQ+ couples wed as Thai same-sex marriage law comes into force
summary: The milestone sees Thailand become by far the biggest nation in Asia to recognize equal marriage, after Taiwan and Nepal.

title: ICC prosecutor seeks arrest of Taliban leaders over persecution of women
summary: Karim Khan said there were reasonable grounds to suspect that Supreme Leader Haibatullah Akhundzada and chief justice Abdul Hakim Haqqani 'bear criminal responsibility for the crime against humanity of persecution on gender grounds.'

title: Donald Trump attempts to establish an 'imperial presidency' in the US
summary: The first decisions taken by the new American president on his arrival at the White House bear witness to his desire to evade the system of checks and balances.

title: Paris's Palais Garnier celebrates 150 years of memories and fantasies
summary: One of Paris's two opera houses, built by Charles Garnier in 1875 and welcoming a million visitors every year, is celebrating its anniversary with a gala, exhibitions and artist residencies.

title: Buckwheat, a tiny seed with huge benefits
summary: It's a favorite with chefs and gluten-free enthusiasts alike. Whether in crepes, chips, granola, soups or tea, this iconic Brittany plant is winning over France.

title: Micheál Martin becomes Ireland's new prime minister
summary: Micheál Martin, 64, was backed by a coalition of members of Ireland's Dáil house of parliament, in a 95 to 76 vote, to become the country's next taoiseach or prime minister, despite the Dáil having been twice suspended by heated rows over speaking time rights.

title: Speakers at Davos attack 'engineers of chaos'
summary: Psychologist Steven Pinker, a guest speaker at the World Economic Forum, insisted that the world isn't as bad as it seems on social media.

title: At Paris Men's Fashion Week, a dazzling restraint
summary: From cargo pants embroidered with pearls at Louis Vuitton to hoodies under a large coat at Auralee and weathered leather jackets at Paul Smith, men's basics come in all shades.
